A longtime teacher himself, now a science advocate and cofounder of Science Genius B.A.T.T.L.E.S. with the GZA of the Wu-Tang Clan, Emdin offers a vision to make the classroom come alive.", "event": "TED@NYC", "language": "en", "language_swap": false, "name": "Christopher Emdin: Teach teachers how to create magic", "slug": "christopher_emdin_teach_teachers_how_to_create_magic", "series_slug": null, "speakers": [{"id": "1861", "slug": "chris_emdin", "is_published": true, "firstname": "Christopher", "lastname": "Emdin", "middleinitial": "", "title": "", "description": "Education pioneer", "photo_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/e1b355cc547a3a0b8ba63921ba693e6508b0dcc0_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "", "whotheyare": "Christopher Emdin is a science advocate who uses hip-hop to make better teachers.", "whylisten": "Chris Emdin believes the best teachers can be found in the unlikeliest of places -- and that traditional education theory is failing our students. That's why he founded Science Genius B.A.T.T.L.E.S. (Bring Attention to Transforming Teaching, Learning and Engagement in Science), which takes the techniques for self-expression and engagement used in hip-hop into the classroom. (Wu-Tang Clan’s GZA is a fan and supporter as well.) Emdin is a contributor to The Huffington Post and is an associate professor at Columbia University’s Teacher’s College."}], "url": "https://www.ted.com/talks/christopher_emdin_teach_teachers_how_to_create_magic", "viewed_count": 2290987, "talks": [{"curator_approved": true, "description": "What do rap shows, barbershop banter and Sunday services have in common? make better teachers.", "whylisten": "Chris Emdin believes the best teachers can be found in the unlikeliest of places -- and that traditional education theory is failing our students. That's why he founded Science Genius B.A.T.T.L.E.S. (Bring Attention to Transforming Teaching, Learning and Engagement in Science), which takes the techniques for self-expression and engagement used in hip-hop into the classroom. (Wu-Tang Clan’s GZA is a fan and supporter as well.) Emdin is a contributor to The Huffington Post and is an associate professor at Columbia University’s Teacher’s College."}], "speaker_name": "Christopher Emdin", "tags": ["education", "science", "teaching", "social change", "religion", "presentation", "storytelling", "magic", "innovation"], "title": "Teach teachers how to create magic", "video_type": {"id": "1", "name": "TED Stage Talk"}, "viewed_count": 2290987}]}

title: Teach teachers how to create magic
